website_summaries.verdict: If it accommodates your height, this dip station is an optimal investment. Its versatility allows you to get in a diverse set of exercises.
pros: A versatile dip station featuring a convenient open pass-through design
Comes w/padded grips and Olympic rings
cons: This dip station is designed for shorter users

customer_reviews.title: This thing is so cool!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. I have wanted to go back to the gym, but can't afford it right now, so I got this this workout station so I could exercise at home. There are a ton of exercises that you can do with this. I was hoping to be able to take it to the beach with me, but it is too heavy and bulky to do that, but it doesn't take up too much space in my condo. It is easy to assemble, made from strong, durable material and wilI be a part of my fitness routine for years to come. I am extremely satisfied with this product
customer_reviews.author: doctor435

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: Some reviewers complained this dip station is for short people or is too small. I am 6 feet and it is perfect with bent knees. If it were any taller one would have to jump up to get in to starting or ending position which could place undue stress on the shoulders and could also cause injury if your muscles are blown at the end of the set. This is perfect height to pretty much step into and the spacing bewtween the grips is where it needs to be to avoid hyper extension and injuries. All in all great product at a great price
customer_reviews.author: Jay Reed

customer_reviews.title: Not Trustworthy
customer_reviews.text: There is something about this contraption that just doesn't feel right. As I get halfway through my dip, I get an impending feeling of doom that it will either collapse or tip over. This could be irrational thinking, but the tool doesn't lend itself to confidence and safety. I have tried on both carpeted and rubber surfaces, but the feeling is the same. That's it! The problem is not in the material, but instead, the construction. To alleviate this, the bottom bar requires lengthening to expand the support and widen the dip path. In the meantime, I may attach a sled to the front and turn it into a toboggan.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Carlson

customer_reviews.title: Easy to build and stronger than expected!
customer_reviews.text: Much lighter than I expected and much stronger than I expected. I included a few pictures for those who have been confused about building it. I found it to be extremely fast to build taking me all of 3 or 4 minutes. It seems pretty sturdy and I was doing a bunch of dips last night on it. It seems well made and is nicely powder coated. You'll need to bend you're legs but this is normal for any dip machine. I think it will be a good addition to my home gym!
customer_reviews.author: David K

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely thrilled!!
customer_reviews.text: I had looked through a lot of products for home use during the COVID quarantine and found this to be the most affordable, functional, versatile, and aesthetically pleasing. This was the one I wanted, but it showed out of stock. I ordered anyway on May 7th with indeterminate delivery, and it arrived by May 15th. I was able to assemble it in ten minutes (I’m a short, sturdy female). It is sturdy enough for me to swing around and do all kinds of exercises. I am absolutely thrilled with this product and highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solid buy overall
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty nice dip station. At 6' I need to bend my knees but that is pretty standard behavior when doing dips. Per the measurements in the product descriptions I think this station may be a few inches taller than some of the others and this contributed to my decision to purchase. The grip material is OK but perhaps could be a little more durable. Overall it is pretty sturdy given the size- certainly good enough. Angle of the bars is ideal and the same angle I'm familiar with from equipment at the gym.
customer_reviews.author: B. Young

customer_reviews.title: Damaged and NO hardware included. NONE
customer_reviews.text: The item arrived in the original Fuel Performance box. The box arrived extremely damaged upon delivery..some portions even open. Opened it up to begin assembling it, and found absolutely NO hardware included in the box. May have fallen out during transport? Something that wouldn't have happened if the box stayed in one piece. It's embarrassing that a product would be delivered by a professional shipping company in such rough shape. Amazon/UPS - Maybe an over-boxing option would be beneficial to improve the integrity of the bexes/packages of this size. Either way, doesn't do me any good now. Returning item.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: If you think this is only for short people then you're doing dips wrong. BEND YOUR KNEES. I'm 5ft 9in 160lbs and it works great. It's well built and sturdy. The grips are nice as well. The distance between each grip bar is perfect. Like how compact it is to easily store it in my closet.
customer_reviews.author: Hairylegs222

customer_reviews.title: Flexes a bit but fits my budget
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Easy to assemble and affordable. Short height makes it easy to use in basement where ceiling is low and no stepping up is required to mount it. It’s not so short that weights hanging from my dip belt would hit the floor. Cons: At 175 lbs + 60 lbs hanging from my dip belt, the handles begin to spread as the frame flexes when I dip. I don’t get the feeling it would collapse, but it’s unnerving nonetheless. I see why there’s a deluxe model with triangular reinforcement plates at the bottom. Other thoughts: Foam grips, while comfy, are not my preference. I might not wait for them to wear or tear before I replace them with grip tape.
customer_reviews.author: Techjunkie

customer_reviews.title: it's a good product. I use it a lot and like ...
customer_reviews.text: Crossfitters read this. It works as advertised. I use it weekly. But, as a crossfitter, I go down very low and my feet brush the ground. I'm 5'11". I wouldn't think it would be that difficult to make the height adjustable. If I could adjust the height, it would be a 5*. It's still usable. But, I'd prefer it to be a few inches higher. Also, you have to position you hands about half way in the middle of the grip. If you place your hands on the ends, it tips a bit. Overall, it's a good product. I use it a lot and like it. Just a few slight tweaks would make it awesome, though.
customer_reviews.author: maestro

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy station
customer_reviews.text: This station feels sturdy. Only complain is that it was a hassle building this. Directions didn't say which way the locking nuts goes in with the washer as both sides are different. Better to build with another person, one holding the bars upright, hard to balance for assembly by oneself, which took me about 20 minutes for a task that should only be 5-10 mins. Overall a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love my dip bar, helps me build my triceps, chest and abdominal muscles...
customer_reviews.author: Bill B

customer_reviews.title: I like that the handles are angled outward slightly
customer_reviews.text: For the price, it's acceptable. I like that the handles are angled outward slightly. Would like a little more height for dips. I'm 5'9" and my knees do not touch the ground, but my foot will sometimes touch the ground when I dip if I let my knees become unbent from a 90 degree angle. Doesn't affect the movement, but is annoying.
customer_reviews.author: weatherhoo

customer_reviews.title: I'm 6-1 and 220 and have no issues with this -- works great
customer_reviews.text: I just got this, so I can't comment on long term use. But it went together fairly easily (use the amazon photo) and was perfectly stable when I used it for dips. There is a little play in the uprights -- you can move them forward and back a little -- but they are solid and do not move when weight is on them. I knocked off one star for that, but I'm happy with the purchase and I think it's a good value for the price. .
customer_reviews.author: picky

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the $$
customer_reviews.text: I got the middle version, the bigger deluxe model but without the rings. It went together pretty easy and all the needed parts were there. I feel like the nuts/screws metal is on the cheap side and will strip if you crank too hard. But otherwise nice. It's sturdy and doesn't move when doing dips and reverse pulls. Perfect to compliment my dumbbells and bench for lockdown home workouts in the garage.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Good to go!
customer_reviews.text: So far, I am very happy with my purchase. This dip station was easy to assemble, is light weight and very sturdy (considering it is priced at under $50.00). You can not compare this product to the commercial models that are found in gyms, but it is ideal for home gyms in that you can move it around and tuck it back into a corner when it's not being used. I will get a lot of use out of this, doing bodyweight dips and the core work that parallel bars allow. Thanks for a solid and inexpensive product.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald McDermott

customer_reviews.title: Otherwise awesome and good
customer_reviews.text: A little short and I'm 5'9". My knees don't hit the ground but when using a dumbbell on a belt it comes really close. Otherwise awesome and good, variable distance between handles.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond

customer_reviews.title: Very simple, but very effective
customer_reviews.text: When I got this I could not perform even 1 full dip. I'd start at the top, lower myself, try to push up, and couldn't. I repeated this many times over many days before I could finally push myself all the way back up that first time. It took many more days before I could do 2. A few days later when I finally could do 3, I was able to keep going to 4. The increases kept coming, and now after 2 months, I can do 50+ within a 1-hour workout.
customer_reviews.author: John L.

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy happy Purchased
customer_reviews.text: Super easy installation all I had to do was put the bottom together. It really Small so great for me since I am only 4'9, and great for my tiny home gym.
customer_reviews.author: David  MoralesTop Contributor: Pokémon

customer_reviews.title: Not Quite Sure
customer_reviews.text: I can't really give this product a review only because I ended up returning it since it was only going to be like 3 feet tall and I was looking for something a bit taller since I'm 6'2" and wanted something high enough to get me off the ground without quite bending my knees so much. If you're looking for something like this I'm sure it's a great product! BUT if you're looking for something taller and adjustable check out on my profile the other dip bar station I purchased and absolutely love!!!
customer_reviews.author: Justin Yale

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I helped my son put this dip station together. Was very easy to do. Great piece of equipment. My only thought was it is a bit short for him as he is 5’11. Not super tall but also didn’t have to break the bank to see if a dip station was something he would get lots of food set out f
customer_reviews.author: Tim Euler

customer_reviews.title: Nice Tool
customer_reviews.text: I was on the road and staying off the beaten path. This was great to have around. Uses: middle support was perfect for weighted calf-raises and stretches, makes a nice make-shift captain's chair for abs/obliques, horizontal pulls and variations (e.g. 1-leg weighted or not horizontal bridge pulls), and of course.. dips. It assembles and comes down easy and doesn't take up much space in the trunk. This and a pair of KBs kept me occupied and working hard without a gym or a barbell for 100 miles in any direction.
customer_reviews.author: peckish

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I have a commercial squat rack from “HOIST” that does not accept dip bar accessories...so I went with this stand-alone unit. I was amazingly surprised. It’s extremely sturdy with no wobble. Not too wide. Tall enough. Great all around.
customer_reviews.author: Nofunofanykind

customer_reviews.title: very narrow, so for a small person
customer_reviews.text: I'm a fit guy, 32 inch waist and cannot get inside without turning sideways, and your hands will be touching your waist as you dip. I can use this, but it's very narrow and if you have elbow problems, you might want to find a wider framed dip rack.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: First what I liked about it was that it didn't look like public bike rack that you see all around town.This thing is rock solid and easy to assemble,it is heavier than others I've seen and that's a plus..Hands are in a comfortable position and the padded grips work well.Great piece of equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Motorhed

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the price
customer_reviews.text: I was undecided, but I went with this one because of the low price. I’m soooooo glad I did! This thing is perfect. Easy to assemble, good height, extremely sturdy, yet lightweight. Fits very easily in a closet. Perfect addition to my home gym
customer_reviews.author: RichinNYC

customer_reviews.title: Move on
customer_reviews.text: Not the best product to use for dips. Small and handles are to close to each other. Not stable at all. Anyone above 5’8 would have difficulty using this due to the size. I have limited space and wanted something compact, but this is not it.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Good product with minor design flaw
customer_reviews.text: I put this together in about 30 minutes. As someone else mentioned it was a little tricky holding everything in place to put the bolts through. Once assembled it works well. My only complaint is that if you pull up on the handles the move a little. I think because the holes for the bolts are a little too big. During normal use this is not a problem when the weight is pushing down on the handles.
customer_reviews.author: ED

customer_reviews.title: At home triceps
customer_reviews.text: I'm only 5'4" and it doesn't feel high enough, but it's doable. My cousin has a similar one and he put it onto some cinder blocks for the raised effect. Of course not as sturdy as real gym equipment, but the small form factor is good to store away when not using it.
customer_reviews.author: 1rene0

customer_reviews.title: Rocking motions.
customer_reviews.text: The stand is sturdy and set at a distance that feels comfortable. The reason for four stars is if I put my hands at the end of the handles in the area that I would like for comfort reasons. The stand would rock a little and occasionally tip. If my hand went forward just a little more more it wouldn't rock and would be just fine but I have a little larger chest frame making it harder to move my hands forward more.
customer_reviews.author: Rylie Twitchell

customer_reviews.title: Will be fine for me.
customer_reviews.text: The positive: arrived when expected, easy to put together with all parts included, pleased with howsturdy it seems, height is ok for me 5'8 but I may add more. The negative: The welds are very sloppy looking.They are uneven and large bumps on them. Two of the rubber/plastic end caps are broken with pieces missing.
customer_reviews.author: Janice Hines

customer_reviews.title: sturdy, YES you can do leg lifts and Yes ...
customer_reviews.text: Just what i expected. sturdy, YES you can do leg lifts and Yes you should be bending your knees anyways. easy to assemble, light weight, and compact. I can do 27 dips with my body weight of 175 lbs and am looking forwards to wearing my 40 lb weight vest.
customer_reviews.author: D. Marcoot

customer_reviews.title: It is a solid fram and good quality. I do wish it was a bit ...
customer_reviews.text: It is a solid fram and good quality. I do wish it was a bit taller as my husband is 6'4" and even with him bending his knees and legs back has a bit of an issue. One of the front handle covers was completely shattered inside the handle when it arrived. I tried contacting the seller to let them know but never received a reply.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Flawed construction
customer_reviews.text: The weld joint holding the grip area onto the upright had visible rust on it when it was brand-new out of the box. Anyone should know you cannot leave bare metal or bare welding exposed. I can only see rust on the surface, but it definitely makes me wonder what's hidden under the paint on the other welds.
customer_reviews.author: Micah Huston

customer_reviews.title: Works good
customer_reviews.text: Works great so far. Not perfectly balanced but I'm able to use it none the less. Easily portable and not heavy if needed to move. Probably not useful for taller people maybe over 6'3 or so. Easy to set up . Grips will wear out eventually but doesnt bother me.
customer_reviews.author: Danny D

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and value.
customer_reviews.text: Overall quality is good...I've got short legs and still manage to touch my knees to the ground...probably would think twice if my inseam was over 31"...
customer_reviews.author: Derrick W

customer_reviews.title: Nice Simple Dip Station
customer_reviews.text: Nice little dip station. I was worried about it taking up room in my already crowded garage but it fits nicely with the legs under the bench press. I am 195lbs and am completely comfortable with the stability of the dip station. I have about a 43 inch chest and the width of the bars are just about perfect. Only gripe is the padding on the bars feel thin and not sure about the longevity. So far so good though.
customer_reviews.author: SUPer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Dip Bar
customer_reviews.text: Awesome Dip bar, was glad I bought this over others.Im 5'7,and have no issues at all.No strain on my repaired rotator cuff too.I would rate this 10 stars.Easy to put together,
customer_reviews.author: Frank Poltrack

customer_reviews.title: Perfect dip station!
customer_reviews.text: I am 5' 9" and can do dips with a belt and 45lb plate attached to me. The plate will barely touch the floor going down. To give you some idea as to the height of the sip station. It is the oerfect width and sturdy as hell. Takes about 10 mins to put togeher. You want a solid dip station? This is it.
customer_reviews.author: Germaen Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: High quality!! Five stars.
customer_reviews.text: Anyone who gives this product less than five stars Is crazy. I take the time to read reviews now more than ever so I don’t get stuck with bad purchases. I got this and put it together wrong the first time. I’m not good at putting things together. That’s just me. But I figured it out without calling the company. I would buy this again and would be just as happy if I had to pay more money.
customer_reviews.author: eric p brown

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: It gets the job done for the time being. However, it’s not the best product. Doesn’t feel all that stable. Also the angles of the legs are a little off.
customer_reviews.author: Louis

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy build
customer_reviews.text: I am pleased with these bars. They could have been made a little higher even an inch would have made this more functional. When you bend your knees in order to dip, my feet hit the ground. Overall good product.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Fort Worth

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for dips and leg lifts for abs
customer_reviews.text: This is great if you are average or short height. Im only 5'3" lady and this is PERFECT for me. This is NOT for you if you are a tall person...your knees would be hitting the ground. Overall SUPER simple to put together in about 5 mins and very sturdy...I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stop looking this is the one
customer_reviews.text: The Fuel deluxe dip station is amazing! The frame is sturdy and strong! Just make sure to tighten everything well with a good wrench and you will be golden! I am 220 lbs and have never felt like it couldn’t handle my weight. The rings are also a great addition expanding the types of exercises you can do! A very fine addition to my home gym!
customer_reviews.author: PC

customer_reviews.title: The assembly directions are absolutely terrible! Just a exploded diagram with small images that ...
customer_reviews.text: The assembly directions are absolutely terrible! Just a exploded diagram with small images that are hard to see. It took about two hours to piece together on my own. It is also worth to note that you will need a wrench in addition to the items provided in order to properly tighten everything so it is not wobbly. Other than that the product is well designed and stable and holds all my weight and is tall enough for my height.
customer_reviews.author: Dale McClung

customer_reviews.title: Might be a bit low to the ground, but otherwise fantastic.
customer_reviews.text: A bit low to the ground (I do weighted dips with plates hung from a belt around my waist, and they hit the floor at the bottom of my range of motion, with my upper arms parallel to the ground), but this is easily solved by propping the stand on cinderblocks. Definitely far too low to dip with legs fully extended, regardless of how you set it up. The rings are an added bonus; I ended up using them on my pullup bar, where they're fantastic for ring dips.
customer_reviews.author: JH

customer_reviews.title: works fine, but it is irritating having to concentrate on ...
customer_reviews.text: I am 5'9, my knees almost hit the ground when doing dips. Quality build, works fine, but it is irritating having to concentrate on my legs not hitting the ground when I dip because it sits so low. I would not have purchased had I known how low it sits.
customer_reviews.author: David M

customer_reviews.title: get those triceps pumped with this
customer_reviews.text: Amazing compact dip bar. A 6-4 person can use this no problem. Very good price and easy to assemble. Directions are bad. My team loves to use this after our Sunday run& strength building workouts.
customer_reviews.author: Iron GYM

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and Well made for Small Place Work Outs
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this so I can work on my upper body at home on days that I do not go to the gym. The dip station of portable and very stable. I am 6'2 and it does what it is meant to do. I also use it to break the boredom at home when I am studying. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: THE DCs

customer_reviews.title: Works well but the quality isn't the best
customer_reviews.text: Pretty easy to assemble and it works well for dips. It's lightweight but sturdy. Why only 3 stars? The first week I started using it, the foam on one of the handles started tearing. It's tearing in the middle of the handle. I can still move the foam around so there is still some padding.
customer_reviews.author: Teamchaos

customer_reviews.title: Great bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: Great bang for your buck! I am 5'10" and don't have to 'jump up' to get on it and there is plenty of clearance from the floor with my knees bent while doing dips. Also doesn't take up a lot of space and I really like the blue grips - very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Robert A.

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love this. Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this. Works as advertised. Very solid, and in addition to dips, you can lay horizontal facing up and use the handles to pull yourself up for a back work out. Also more compact than many other dip stands. Very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Leodeenyo

customer_reviews.title: Falling apart after only 6 days use ...
customer_reviews.text: Seriously? The station hasn’t been stationary since assembling, hasn’t been moved a tremendous amount, hasn’t been used for any other intended use and is already falling apart. So ridiculous, will be attempting to return for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Ricky

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and does the job
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this is a solid setup for dips. The welds are not pretty, but it is sturdy unlike some of those cheap ones you see on amazon. Install was easy.
customer_reviews.author: Kes

customer_reviews.title: Nice product, works as intended
customer_reviews.text: Nice product,works as intended. Holds my weight with no issues and I'm 200lbs. I'm also 6' tall with a longer torso and had no issues with my knees touching the ground.
customer_reviews.author: G. Beer

customer_reviews.title: Best Buy
customer_reviews.text: I was shocked how sturdy this thing was. I weigh 215lbs and do 50 dips, it holds up. It hasn’t moved around and nuts and bolts stay in place. The material, metal is a good thickness. The rings are metal and the straps are also of good material.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Vazquez

customer_reviews.title: Effective and inexpensive
customer_reviews.text: You can't beat this for the price. It is a little lower than what you encounter in a gym but it shouldn't matter since you need to bend your legs to do dips anyway. Easy to put together and works effectively.
customer_reviews.author: E. Krise

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Piece of Equipment!
customer_reviews.text: I love this device. It's awesome! I not sure what some of the people in the review are talking about when they say it's too small. I am 5 11" and have no issue reaching down as far as my arms will allow me to go with a lot of room left between my knees and the ground. I think the people who said that this is too small were expecting to do dips with their legs straight out...
customer_reviews.author: Osvaldo Acevedo

customer_reviews.title: Go for the Pro
customer_reviews.text: Not bad, although mine's came in defective and I returned it. But I suggest you go for their more solid version (Pro). It's currently less that $10 more. I did and am glad.
customer_reviews.author: JG

customer_reviews.title: Keeps me company
customer_reviews.text: Would have been nice if it came with dip but overall really happy with it. I chew a lot of tobaccco so it’s nice to have a station to go to when I’m all alone.
customer_reviews.author: Kelvin

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I really love this piece of equipment. I’m using it for inverted rows as well as chest and tricep dips. Works really well, was easy to assemble and is sturdy/high enough for me. I’m 6’0 175 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: aab

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Great dip machine seems to be made very well I paid $55 for this about a month ago now it’s 103 prices vary so much of Amazon
customer_reviews.author: 91TA

customer_reviews.title: I like it !
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy, perfect for my home gym as it doesn't take up much space.
customer_reviews.author: mrkrob

customer_reviews.title: Love the dip station
customer_reviews.text: Love the dip station. A great workout, bars are at a good angle not just straight. Lightweight, but incredibly durable. It was even, strong, and didn’t take much space. If you’re getting a dip station for home use this is the one.
customer_reviews.author: David H.

customer_reviews.title: RUSTED
customer_reviews.text: It came with rust on it, do not buy! Cheaply made from a sketchy company.
customer_reviews.author: Brendan Lynch

customer_reviews.title: Fuel Pureformance Deluxe Dip Station
customer_reviews.text: A great piece for focusing on tricep dips; nice and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Devon

customer_reviews.title: You won’t regret it
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product ; easy to assemble , compact ; gets the job done !
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Material Solid. Good at 5'10".
customer_reviews.text: First got a bad part that could have easily been replaced the company, but they did not respond for almost a week. Amazon actually shipped another for the replacement and the product works well for me. It is a bit short, but dip exercises are done with the leg bent at the knees so I see no problem at 5'10".
customer_reviews.author: HIBigIsle

customer_reviews.title: Great but a little wide
customer_reviews.text: Bars are a little wide for my preference: 5’6”, male
customer_reviews.author: PHIL

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: The bolts and locknuts aren’t sized to complete assembly. Worthless.
customer_reviews.author: Antonio

customer_reviews.title: Can pads be purchased separately?
customer_reviews.text: I really like this dip station but unfortunately the passing on one of the bars came with a tiny tear and it just keeps getting bigger after every use. I would love to give it give stars of there was a way to buy a replacement pad. Other than that it is a nice looking piece of equipment and does the job
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comes loose and nuts and bolts aren’t that great.
customer_reviews.text: For the price I paid around $70-90 it’s not worth it, if you get this for around $40-60 it’s worth it, they should give you a little more for that price tbh
customer_reviews.author: Carmine

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: Super sturdy. Awesome product. Must buy for a home workout
customer_reviews.author: Darian

customer_reviews.title: Great. No answer from the company
customer_reviews.text: Missing a bolt. Great. No answer from the company. Probably won’t get the part for weeks. The thing only comes with 4 bolts and you missed one? Great quality control.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: It's awesome. The handles angle outward slightly so you can get the right width for your body. I used a socket wrench to get the bolts nice and tight. I wish I had this years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I wanted for triceps dips and leg raises. The rings are an added bonus - now I have another option for push-ups and chest flies. I'm a 5'4" woman and find the parallel bars to be comfortably spaced (I'd prefer them just a tiny bit closer, but then this wouldn't work for taller people). My cousin, who is a very fit guy, also likes this dip station.
customer_reviews.author: Jen G.Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: You can get a great upperbody workout on this
customer_reviews.text: You can get a great upperbody workout on this. Very durable and well designed. Slide the ring belts towards the ends of the handles (not too close to the ends) to avoid hitting your face when you wear yourself out doing ring pushups. this didnt happen, but there is definite potential.
customer_reviews.author: Kenn

customer_reviews.title: Keep hands towards front of the grips for better control.
customer_reviews.text: Working out great for me and easy to move around.
customer_reviews.author: WAL -LE

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding dip bar
customer_reviews.text: Great dip bar. I've owned many and this is my favorite.
customer_reviews.author: thomas matthews

customer_reviews.title: Perfect bar dip station for home
customer_reviews.text: Perfect bar dip station for home. I'm 6'0 225 lbs knees don't hit the ground like others claim. Sturdy not wobbly. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: ChanelStar

customer_reviews.title: Works ok but it’s too low
customer_reviews.text: Works fine but they really should indicate that this is a very low to the ground so you have to do the dips with your knees bent.
customer_reviews.author: MCW

customer_reviews.title: Improve instructions!
customer_reviews.text: Assembly instructions are awful. This thing is impossible to put together, it’s an expensive paper weight without a wrench! I had to spend an extra 30$ for a supply kit just to get a wrench to put this together! Solid construction otherwise!
customer_reviews.author: MaC

customer_reviews.title: Not sure why people are having issues putting this together ...
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why people are having issues putting this together I knocked it out in 10 minutes. Everything lined right up, I do suggest a ratcheting box end wrench or socket for ease of bolt tightening.
customer_reviews.author: Brian L.

customer_reviews.title: Great Dip Station
customer_reviews.text: I encourage you to buy the more expensive one. It’s very sturdy and has comfortable padding for your hands. I love it! Definitely recommend this one
customer_reviews.author: Austen Shoup

customer_reviews.title: Handles are comfortable. Dip station rocks back and forth if you're ...
customer_reviews.text: Handles are comfortable. Dip station rocks back and forth if you're not positioned in the sweet spot of the handle bars. Quick fix, just stack some weight on the legs to prevent any movement.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price.
customer_reviews.text: For the price you really can't complain. Took maybe 10 minutes to assemble solo. I recommend a ratchet with either a 17mm socket or 11/16, a shallow socket may not cut it. I personally used a 17mm ratcheting open end wrench. I'm 5'10" 175lbs and have no issues doing deep dips. The unit is pretty sturdy on tile and even better on rubber work out matts. I don't see the grips lasting very long though. That's about my only gripe.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Loose grips
customer_reviews.text: Does the job but grips came loose after a month..
customer_reviews.author: Shopper510

customer_reviews.title: Great quality!
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a gift for my boyfriend. He loved it! Sturdy, the rings are a great addition to the dip bar. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Amazing deal!
customer_reviews.text: This is great for someone of average height or less. I can not promise that a tall man, with a long range of motion, will be able to make good use of this. I am 5'7 for reference.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan mesch

customer_reviews.title: No wrench
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy as heck. But you'll need a socket or crescent wrench. It doesn't come with one.
customer_reviews.author: Toe Cutter

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy quality
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy, the grips have held up well. The bars are flared outward which is non-traditional but it still works the chest and triceps really well. Went from sets of 5 to sets of 50, so it definitely does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: easy to assemble and works fine
customer_reviews.text: easy to assemble and works fine. It's sturdy as well, light weight and does what it is supposed to do .
customer_reviews.author: Jubin Pejman

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Probably my mistake didn't check measurements but way too short for an adult
customer_reviews.author: james r cook jr

customer_reviews.title: Great addition
customer_reviews.text: Works great, perfect for Dips. Arms are already getting bigger. Was a great addition to my home gym.
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: Not my favorite...
customer_reviews.text: It's not as high as I would have liked. I'm 5'10'' and its really too short. Puts too much pressure on my shoulders.
customer_reviews.author: Fit Customer

customer_reviews.title: Incomplete package
customer_reviews.text: Product was incomplete, missing screws and rings to assemble it . Returning item soon
customer_reviews.author: Omar Meza

customer_reviews.title: Too narrow that wont let your body go up> it doesnt look like the picture they posted
customer_reviews.text: The dip station is so narrow that won't let your body go up and down
customer_reviews.author: Carlos

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Husband was able to put together within an hour. Sturdy and solid for what he uses it for. Great buy all around. He loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Chest..front delts..and tris on the cheap
customer_reviews.text: Great for the price. Easy to put together and good quality. Dips for days.
customer_reviews.author: Sicilianized

customer_reviews.title: A bit overpriced
customer_reviews.text: Not bad for a 200lb person. Wish it had better rubber stands (feet).
customer_reviews.author: Alex Black

product_meta.title: Fuel Pureformance Deluxe Dip Station
feature_bullets: SPECS – Assembled dimensions are 29. 92" x 24. 8" x 38. 58" and includes Olympic style rings.
CONSTRUCTION – Built with 12- and 14-gauge steel with a durable, powder coat finish and gussets for added stability.

FEATURES – Angled, padded grips add comfort; open, pass through design adds versatility; 12- and 14-gauge steel construction with gussets adds stability; durable powder coat finish to prevent rusting. Includes rings for added resistance.
VERSATILE – This bodyweight training dip station allows you to target the chest, shoulders, triceps, abs, legs and more. Add more resistance by using the included Olympic style rings.
FUNCTIONAL– Open, pass through design allows multiple exercises to be performed, such as chest dips, pull ups, hanging leg and knee raises, and more.

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
